Progress Tracking and Statistics for NPeg

This module provides progress tracking, statistics, and cancellation support for NPeg parsers. It allows users to:

  1. Track parsing progress with callbacks
  2. Collect detailed parsing statistics (speed, ETA, etc.)
  3. Cancel parsing operations
  4. Throttle progress updates for UI responsiveness

Basic usage:

# Create a callback function for progress updates
proc progressCallback(progress: float, stats: ProgressStats) =
  echo "Progress: ", int(progress * 100), "%, ETA: ", formatDuration(stats.estimatedTimeRemaining)

# Create a progress tracker
let tracker = newProgressTracker(
  totalSize = myData.len,
  callback = progressCallback
)

# Use the tracker with a parser
let result = myParser.match(myData, tracker)

Features:

  • Progress reporting with customizable thresholds
  • Detailed statistics (bytes processed, speed, ETA)
  • Callback throttling to prevent UI overload
  • Manual or automatic cancellation
  • Formatting helpers for human-readable output

Imports

common

Types

CancellationCallback = proc (): bool {.closure.}
NPegCancellationError = object of NPegException
ProgressCallback = proc (progress: float; stats: ProgressStats) {.closure.}
ProgressStats = object
  startTime*: float
  currentTime*: float
  elapsedTime*: float
  bytesProcessed*: int
  totalBytes*: int
  instructionsExecuted*: int
  bytesPerSecond*: float
  instructionsPerSecond*: float
  estimatedTimeRemaining*: float
  progressPercent*: float
ProgressTracker = ref object
  totalSize*: int
  lastReportedProgress*: float
  callback*: ProgressCallback
  reportThreshold*: float
  enabled*: bool
  updateInterval*: int
  cancellationToken*: CancellationCallback
  cancelled*: bool
  startTime*: float
  lastUpdateTime*: float
  initialSamples*: int
  samplesCollected*: int
  speedSamples*: seq[float]
  lastInstructionCount*: int
  throttlingMode*: ThrottlingMode
  throttleTimeMs*: int
  lastCallbackTime*: float
  minProgressDelta*: float
ProgressUpdateProc = proc (tracker: pointer; currentPos: int;
                           instructionCount: int) {....gcsafe, nimcall.}
ThrottlingMode = enum
  tmNone, tmTime, tmProgressDelta

Procs

proc calculateStats(tracker: ProgressTracker; currentPos: int;
                    instructionCount: int): ProgressStats {....raises: [],
    tags: [TimeEffect], forbids: [].}
Calculate progress statistics based on current state 
proc configureThrottling(tracker: ProgressTracker; mode: ThrottlingMode;
                         timeMs: int = 100; progressDelta: float = 0.01) {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Configure callback throttling for progress updates

Parameters: mode: Throttling mode to use timeMs: Minimum time between callbacks in milliseconds (for tmTime mode) progressDelta: Minimum progress change to trigger callback (for tmProgressDelta mode)

proc enableProgressTracking(tracker: ProgressTracker; enabled: bool) {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Enable or disable progress tracking

Returns: A human-readable string representation of the duration

Returns: A human-readable string representation of the size

    forbids: [].}

Format a speed in bytes per second to a human-readable string

Parameters: bytesPerSecond: Speed in bytes per second

Returns: A human-readable string representation of the speed

proc formatStats(stats: ProgressStats): string {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}

Format progress statistics to a human-readable string

Parameters: stats: Progress statistics

Returns: A human-readable string representation of the statistics

proc getStatistics(tracker: ProgressTracker; currentPos: int;
                   instructionCount: int): ProgressStats {....raises: [],
    tags: [TimeEffect], forbids: [].}

Get the current parsing statistics

Parameters: currentPos: Current position in the input being parsed instructionCount: Number of instructions executed so far

Returns: A ProgressStats object with the current statistics

proc isCancelled(tracker: ProgressTracker): bool {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}

Check if parsing has been cancelled through the cancellation token

Returns: True if parsing has been cancelled, false otherwise

proc manualCancel(tracker: ProgressTracker) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Manually cancel parsing without using the cancellation token 
proc newProgressTracker(totalSize: int; callback: ProgressCallback;
                        reportThreshold = 0.01; updateInterval = 1000;
                        cancellationToken: CancellationCallback = nil;
                        throttlingMode = tmNone; throttleTimeMs = 100;
                        minProgressDelta = 0.01): ProgressTracker {....raises: [],
    tags: [TimeEffect], forbids: [].}

Create a new progress tracker with specified parameters

Parameters: totalSize: Total size of the input being parsed callback: Function to call when progress is updated reportThreshold: Minimum change in progress to trigger a callback (default: 0.01 or 1%) updateInterval: How often to check for progress updates in instructions (default: 1000) cancellationToken: Optional callback that returns true if parsing should be cancelled throttlingMode: How to throttle callback invocations (default: tmNone) throttleTimeMs: Minimum time between callbacks in milliseconds (default: 100) minProgressDelta: Minimum progress change to trigger callback when using tmProgressDelta (default: 0.01 or 1%)

proc resetProgress(tracker: ProgressTracker) {....raises: [], tags: [TimeEffect],
    forbids: [].}
Reset the progress tracker to its initial state 
proc updateProgress(tracker: ProgressTracker; currentPos: int) {.
    ...raises: [Exception], tags: [TimeEffect, RootEffect], forbids: [].}

Update the current progress and trigger the callback if needed

Parameters: currentPos: Current position in the input being parsed
